definition: to change/to become different/to transform/to vary/rebellion

sentences.english: W2: The exciting atmosphere of change and development.
sentences.chinese: 那令人振奋的巨变和发展氛围。

sentences.english: In some ways, the upheaval will be a welcome one.
sentences.chinese: 在有些方面，巨变倍受欢迎。

sentences.english: The first represented a shift from agriculture to manufacturing.
sentences.chinese: 第一次巨变是从农业向制造业的转移。

sentences.english: The full implications of this population revolution remain to be felt.
sentences.chinese: 这个人口巨变带来的全部影响还有待观察。

sentences.english: This geographical shift has brought dramatic changes in style and substance.
sentences.chinese: 区位的改变造成了风格和重心的巨变。

sentences.english: The statues of former navy generals stand rock-firm, silently observing Weihai's tremendous changes.
sentences.chinese: 海军将领的雕像昂然屹立，静观着威海的沧桑巨变。

sentences.english: Like so much else in China, themeaning of shanzhai is undergoing a drastic change.
sentences.chinese: 就像其他正在中国发生的事情，山寨正经历着巨变。

sentences.english: The sheer power of electronic commerce (e-commerce) will change the face of trade dramatically.
sentences.chinese: 电子商务的惊人威力会使贸易发生巨变。

sentences.english: So what has changed in Iran to bring about this remarkable shift?
sentences.chinese: 那么，伊朗的如此巨变究竟是因何产生的？

sentences.english: Profound changes have taken place in both China and ASEAN countries.
sentences.chinese: 中国和东盟国家都发生了沧海巨变。

sentences.english: I have experienced this transformation of your country in a highly personal way.
sentences.chinese: 我个人亲身体验了贵国的这一巨变。

sentences.english: Drastic changes have taken place in China since 1911 Revolution broke out 100 years ago.
sentences.chinese: 辛亥革命一百年来，中华大地发生沧桑巨变。

sentences.english: How will this enormous shift change things at Mercedes?
sentences.chinese: 这一巨变将如何改变梅塞德斯？

sentences.english: The last decade has seen a sea change in global trade.
sentences.chinese: 过去10年见证了全球贸易领域的风云巨变。

sentences.english: In China, the carton machinery industry is undergoing change.
sentences.chinese: 当前，我国纸箱机械行业正在发生着巨变。

sentences.english: Changes in the new Fengjie people, has become a habit.
sentences.chinese: 巨变对于新奉节人来说，已经成为习惯。

definition: sky and the earth turning upside down (idiom); fig. complete confusion/everything turned on its head
variant of 動蕩|动荡[dong4 dang4]
turbulent situation/changing (face, scene, situation, world of etc)
to surge like a gathering storm (idiom)/to grow by leaps and bounds
sky and the earth turning upside down (idiom); fig. complete confusion/everything turned on its head
to rise abruptly (to a towering position)/to tower over/to spring up/to emerge suddenly/the emergence (e.g. of a power)
